intro: Harveya liebuschiana, commonly known as the Liebuschian harveya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Harveya liebuschiana is a perennial herb that produces small, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
